_decoded_content.title: Bump version of dbt to 0.20.2
_decoded_content.description: 0.20.2 is now released https://github.com/dbt-labs/dbt/releases/tag/v0.20.2

_decoded_content.title: Discovery plugin configuration for sqlfluff is out-of-date
_decoded_content.description:
See Quirk 1 of my [sqlfluff demo project](https://gitlab.com/rabidaudio/meltano-sqlfluff-example/-/blob/de2668fce723b9ec3249dc382b01fdb4a67dfbfd/README.md#quirks)

SQLFluff added support for DBT-based templating but this isn't supported by the current configuration in [`discovery.yml`](https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/blob/78f6da64f96508ef9e533631f8f047a3e3ac4bf9/src/meltano/core/bundle/discovery.yml#L2578)

_decoded_content.title: Pinning dbt version to minor or major version
_decoded_content.description:
When dbt 0.20.0 was released we started to pin to the major (0.20) version instead of the minor version. We should consider switching this back to pin minor versions.

However, given that we do not want Meltano to become stale again by falling behind minor release bumps we should consider alternative ways to streamline the process of monitoring and perhaps periodically auto-bumping the version.

As @pandemicsyn suggested, we may also want a scheduled job to run against main and be our "canary" job for external conflict detection.

(In the recent case of #2913, it seems the python version bump was the culprit but I don't know if we want to pin to each minor release of python.)

_decoded_content.title: Compatibility with `dbt Power User` extension for VS Code
_decoded_content.description:
In order to promote the best possible development experience for Meltano dbt users, we should support the [dbt Power User](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=innoverio.vscode-dbt-power-user) extension for VS Code.

When I attempted this for the Academy labs, I found that the extension was not able to find the dbt resources. The most likely explanation was that the extension was looking for `dbt_project.yml` in the root project directory - but there may be other explanations and mitigations available.

I am not against having `dbt_project.yml` at the root directory, and I think there may be other strong advantages of doing so - such as providing dbt with resources within other top-level folders.

_decoded_content.title: Update documentation to make it clear what env_alias does for settings, particularly for dbt
_decoded_content.description:
The `profiles.yml` file uses `PG_HOST` `PG_PORT` etc. But most workflows use `TARGET_POSTGRES_HOST` `TARGET_POSTGRES_PORT` etc. i.e. https://meltano.com/docs/getting-started.html#configure-the-loader

What is the intention for the default `profiles.yml`? I created a pretty barebones repo with Meltano + 1 tap + dbt project + postgres and was surprised that I had to edit the `profiles.yml` myself. My setup: https://github.com/lightdash/full-stack-tap-github

_decoded_content.title: Transformations are not run when extractor is an inheriting plugin
_decoded_content.description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.

If you are submitting an issue with a tap, please include:

- account details
- target details
- entities selected  with meltano select (if you have selected any entities), as the bug may be related to a specific entity
- the full elt command you are running
- full output of the meltano elt command. Logs can get pretty long, so you can add the full log as a snippet in the Meltano project and add a link in the issue.
--->

### What is the current *bug* behavior?
When running a pipeline with a transformation step, `dbt` does nothing. It outputs this:
```
Running with dbt=0.19.1
[WARNING]: Configuration paths exist in your dbt_project.yml file which do not apply to any resources.
There are 1 unused configuration paths:
- models.tap_google_analytics.vars

Found 12 models, 0 tests, 0 snapshots, 0 analyses, 156 macros, 0 operations, 0 seed files, 0 sources, 0 exposures
The selector '' does not match any nodes and will be ignored
The selector 'tap_google_analytics__11111' does not match any nodes and will be ignored
The selector 'my_meltano_project' does not match any nodes and will be ignored
WARNING: Nothing to do. Try checking your model configs and model specification args
```

When debug log level is enabled, I see this message in logs:
> Variable '$MELTANO_TRANSFORM__PACKAGE_NAME' is missing from the environment.  
> Variable '$MELTANO_TRANSFORM__PACKAGE_NAME' is missing from the environment.  
> Variable '$MELTANO_TRANSFORM__PACKAGE_NAME' is missing from the environment.

It appears three times right before:
> DEBUG Invoking: ['/project/.meltano/transformers/dbt/venv/bin/dbt', 'clean']


As a consequence, `dbt` receives a wrong --models parameter: it lacks the transform plugin package name. I'm trying to run models from https://gitlab.com/meltano/dbt-tap-google-analytics

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?
`dbt` should transform data.


### Steps to reproduce
Here's my config:
```yaml
version: 1
send_anonymous_usage_stats: true
project_id: ...
plugins:
  extractors:
  - name: tap-google-analytics--11111
    inherit_from: tap-google-analytics
    variant: meltano
    pip_url: git+https://gitlab.com/meltano/tap-google-analytics.git
    config:
      key_file_location: ...
      view_id: ...
      start_date: ...
    load_schema: google_analytics_app
  loaders:
  - name: target-bigquery
    variant: adswerve
    pip_url: git+https://github.com/adswerve/target-bigquery.git@v0.10.2
    config:
      credentials_path: ...
      project_id: ...
      validate_records: true
  transforms:
  - name: tap-google-analytics
    variant: meltano
    pip_url: git+https://gitlab.com/meltano/dbt-tap-google-analytics.git@config-version-2
  transformers:
  - name: dbt
    pip_url: dbt==0.19.1
schedules:
- name: google-analytics--11111-to-bigquery
  extractor: tap-google-analytics--11111
  loader: target-bigquery
  transform: only
  interval: '@daily'
  start_date: 2005-01-01 00:00:00
```

I run `meltano/meltano:v1.77.0-python3.7` Docker image.

I used this command to see debug logs:
> meltano --log-level=debug elt tap-google-analytics--11111 target-bigquery --transform=only


### Relevant logs and/or screenshots
Nothing else to add.



### Possible fixes
I tried setting `package_name` in the transform plugin but it didn't help.

I checked the code in this repo and saw that the env. variable is covered by tests. So, there might be an edge case. I'm using `transform: only` in the pipeline – maybe this is the cause?



### Further regression test
_Ensure we automatically catch similar issues in the future_

- [ ] Write additional adequate test cases and submit test results
- [ ] Test results should be reviewed by a person from the team

_decoded_content.title: Follow guidance to make dbt packages more platform agnostic
_decoded_content.description:
dbt has a number of design capabilities for creating transform packages which work on multiple platforms. This is not viable for every single package or platform, since SQL language elements such as CTEs and window functions are not going to be implemented generically when the platform doesn't support those features. However, for many other vendor-specific language elements (date functions, for instance), there generally is a more ANSI-compliant manner to write the transform, and/or a dbt utility function which can by transliterated to the platform specific version as part of jinja compilation.

Related to: #2794

------------

More info and guidance here: https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/guides/building-packages#implement-cross-database-compatibility

![image](/uploads/c7d5611ad13999d55b14a28c82281891/image.png)

_decoded_content.title: Publish dbt packages to https://hub.getdbt.com/
_decoded_content.description:
Publishing to dbtHub could give ~~2~~ 3 significant benefits:

1. Allow installation via semantic versioning, which could give a better versioning option vs the branch-pinning solution for `config-version-2` updates needed for #2694. (Semver range restrictions are only available for hub-hosted packages.)
2. Introduce dbt users to Meltano by surfacing our work there on https://hub.getdbt.com/
3. Attract users (and community contributors) for those packages.

@tayloramurphy, @DouweM - Thoughts?

Checklist:

- [ ] Documentation:
    - [ ] Readmes should answer: "What is Meltano?" and "What is Singer?".
    - [ ] Readmes should mention all streams need to be selected.
    - [ ] Readmes should have a short walkthrough (and/or link to one) using meltano to sink from tap to target and run the transform.
    - [ ] We should note which database(s) each package has been tested on. If possible, we should try to add Snowflake as well as Postgres.
- [ ] CI Testing
    - [ ] We should require an end-to-end CI test for each before publishing to Meltano hub. (This could be the first Meltano experience for many new users, and I expect there could be a large demand/interest.)
- [ ] Migration:
    - [ ] GitHub project migration or mirroring (barring GitLab support on Meltano side https://github.com/fishtown-analytics/hub.getdbt.com/issues/571)

_decoded_content.title: Upload dbt artifacts on run end
_decoded_content.description:
### Problem to solve
Meltano manages persisting dbt artifacts to some data store so users can easily leverage that metadata.


### Target audience
Meltano users who also use the dbt integration to transform raw data loaded to a data warehouse target.


### Further details
`dbt` generates a number of artifacts over the course of a `run` that are documented [here](https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/artifacts/dbt-artifacts). These artifacts contain useful metadata about the run itself, tables and views created by your dbt project your data warehouse, etc and can be used to power a number of use cases like analyzing run times and bottlenecks - see an example [here](https://github.com/tailsdotcom/dbt_artifacts).


### Proposal
Idk


### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?
One possible set of acceptance criteria would be that a Meltano user is able to specify a Cloud Storage bucket URI in meltano.yml and Meltano manages uploading any generated artifacts to the bucket. It might also be useful to be able to select what artifacts to upload. 

### Regression test
(Ensure the feature doesn't cause any regressions)
- [ ] Write adequate test cases and submit test results
- [ ] Test results should be reviewed by a person from the team

_decoded_content.title: update default dbt version to 0.18.2
_decoded_content.description:
This issue is being created to document an MR already in progress.

At this moment, meltano uses `dbt==0.16.1` for the dbt transformer.  There appear to be some installation issues with pinned version of dbt related to `agate` and `PyICU` dependencies.

dbt recently released https://github.com/fishtown-analytics/dbt/releases/tag/v0.18.2, which pins `agate<1.6.2` to avoid installation errors relating to its new dependency `PyICU`.  

Testing was successful installing `dbt==0.18.2` from meltano:

```
 transformers:
  - name: dbt
    # pip_url: dbt==0.16.1
    pip_url: dbt==0.18.2
```


Note there are significant differences in parsing dbt_project files between versions. Migration guide here: https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/guides/migration-guide/upgrading-to-0-17-0

_decoded_content.title: How can Meltano aid in post-load deduplication
_decoded_content.description:
Part of https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2504 is acknowledging that after loading there may be some duplication of records. Meltano should be able to help with deduplication whether through dbt or some other tooling. 

--- old issue description. ---

Depending on the replication mode of a tap/target, it's not safe to assume that extracted data is unique in its raw form in the destination. This is solved in the modern stack by using dbt to create a "base" or "source" layer on top of the raw data to deduplicate and do simple cleaning of the data. We did this on the data team https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/business-ops/data-team/platform/dbt-guide/#source-models

It seems like it should be possible to have as part of the SDK a default base model generated for any data coming through the from the tap. Depending on the replication mode we'd need to pass (at least) the following:

* primary key (could be surrogate)
* updated_at timestamp

Not clear to me is if this would be a native part of the target or if it'd have to be a part of a separate package.

_decoded_content.title: meltano transform confusing user experience
_decoded_content.description:
A user from the dbt slack group (Matt Trinkle) was having some trouble running transforms. He was running `meltano elt tap-braintree target-postgres --transform only` and meltano/dbt wasn't actually running any models. meltano output
meltano | Extract & load skipped. meltano | Running transformation... dbt | Running with dbt=0.16.1 dbt | Checking ../.meltano/transformers/dbt/target/* dbt | ERROR: not cleaning ../.meltano/transformers/dbt/target/* because it is protected dbt | Checking dbt_modules/* dbt | Cleaned dbt_modules/* dbt | Checking logs/* dbt | Cleaned logs/* dbt | Finished cleaning all paths. dbt | Running with dbt=0.16.1 dbt | Warning: No packages were found in packages.yml dbt | Running with dbt=0.16.1 dbt | WARNING: Test 'test.fixd_meltano.unique_subscriptions_id' (models/braintree/models.yml) depends on a node named 'subscriptions' which was not found dbt | WARNING: Test 'test.fixd_meltano.not_null_subscriptions_id' (models/braintree/models.yml) depends on a node named 'subscriptions' which was not found dbt | WARNING: Test 'test.fixd_meltano.not_null_subscriptions_created_at' (models/braintree/models.yml) depends on a node named 'subscriptions' which was not found dbt | WARNING: Test 'test.fixd_meltano.not_null_subscription_status_history_subscription_id' (models/braintree/models.yml) depends on a node named 'subscription_status_history' which was not found dbt | WARNING: Test 'test.fixd_meltano.not_null_subscription_status_history_timestamp' (models/braintree/models.yml) depends on a node named 'subscription_status_history' which was not found dbt | WARNING: Test 'test.fixd_meltano.unique_transactions_id' (models/braintree/models.yml) depends on a node named 'transactions' which was not found dbt | WARNING: Test 'test.fixd_meltano.not_null_transactions_id' (models/braintree/models.yml) depends on a node named 'transactions' which was not found dbt | WARNING: Test 'test.fixd_meltano.not_null_transactions_timestamp' (models/braintree/models.yml) depends on a node named 'transactions' which was not found dbt | WARNING: Configuration paths exist in your dbt_project.yml file which do not apply to any resources. dbt | There are 3 unused configuration paths: dbt | - snapshots.gitlab.issues_snapshot dbt | - snapshots.gitlab dbt | - snapshots.gitlab.merge_requests_snapshot dbt | dbt | Found 20 models, 125 tests, 2 snapshots, 0 analyses, 131 macros, 0 operations, 4 seed files, 14 sources dbt | WARNING: Nothing to do. Try checking your model configs and model specification args meltano | Transformation complete! ```
we eventually figured out that the schema.yml (model.yml in his case) wasn't quite right with a missing column key. But more fundamentally the folder directory was wrong. Meltano was looking for `tap_gitlab` or `tap_braintree` but he had `gitlab` and `braintree` in the structure. * Is there a way to override the directory name when calling out to dbt? * Is there a way to pass to dbt from meltano dbt-specific commands? i.e. `dbt run --models braintree_subscription`

_decoded_content.title: Add native support for running `dbt test` as part of `meltano elt`
_decoded_content.description:
### Problem to solve
As a fan of `dbt`, I really like the ability to run `dbt test` as part of my regular ELT pipelines. In fact, outside of Meltano I'd probably setup Airflow DAGs that would run a dbt project in stages like:
1. `dbt test` against the source rows that have been EL'd in
2. `dbt run` to build the analytics models
3. `dbt test` again to validate the analytics models

If any of those tasks fail, the whole DAG would fail. However, there doesn't seem to be a way to actually run `dbt test` as part of a `meltano elt` pipeline, which means that I would have to refactor my project to use Meltano for "EL" but dbt and airflow separately for the rest...

So overall, the problem is that: **I want meltano to support running dbt tests in my pipelines so I can be confident about the quality of my pipeline runs without configuring a separate dbt project**.


### Target audience
Data engineers who want to use `dbt test` to automate schema and data tests for their pipelines.


### Proposal
My initial idea would maybe be to extend `meltano elt` with another argument, like...
```
meltano elt tap-gitlab target-postgres --transform run --test
```

If the `transformer` supports it, that would add a "test" stage on the end of the pipeline so that it would become tap > target > transform > test.


### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?
Not sure; I'm sure the maintainers here would have a better idea of how to tackle this...

For me, success would be that I could guarantee that `dbt test` runs every time the related tap runs :smile: 

### Regression test
(Ensure the feature doesn't cause any regressions)
- [ ] Write adequate test cases and submit test results
- [ ] Test results should be reviewed by a person from the team

### Links / references

_Please note that this was taken from GitLab, to be changed accordingly_

_decoded_content.title: Add option to include config env vars of other plugins in plugin invocation environment
_decoded_content.description:
### What is the current *bug* behavior?
I've configured a handful of dbt tests in my meltano project, but when I try to run them via `meltano invoke dbt test` a rather cryptic error occurs:
```
root@1d67acfca30b:/project# meltano invoke dbt test
Running with dbt=0.16.1
Encountered an error:
Compilation Error
  Env var required but not provided: 'DBT_TARGET'
```

A workaround for this is to manually specify all the ENV vars that the dbt command seems to rely on, e.g.
```
root@66ebf1065348:/project# DBT_TARGET=postgres PG_ADDRESS=postgres PG_PORT=5432 PG_USERNAME=... PG_PASSWORD=... PG_DATABASE=... meltano invoke dbt test
```

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?
I'd expect that, since the `dbt` transform stage works correctly when invoked via `meltano elt`, it should also be possible to run `meltano invoke dbt` commands directly through some mechanism.


### Steps to reproduce
1. Create a new meltano project with a tap and loader
2. Install dbt as a transformer
3. Define a `schema.yml` file with at least one schema test (see dbt docs for this)
4. Run the pipeline transform via `meltano elt`, using the `--transform only` flag, and check the dbt output to ensure your tests exist:
```
root@66ebf1065348:/project# meltano schedule run mysql-to-postgres --transform only
meltano | Extract & load skipped.
meltano | Running transformation...
dbt     | Running with dbt=0.16.1
dbt     | Checking ../.meltano/transformers/dbt/target/*
dbt     | Found 1 model, 8 tests, 0 snapshots, 0 analyses, 127 macros, 0 operations, 0 seed files, 0 sources
```
(notice the "8 tests" in the log above)

5. Try running `meltano invoke dbt test`
6. Notice an error like the above


### Relevant logs and/or screenshots
See examples above


### Possible fixes
It seems the root cause for this is that `meltano invoke dbt` is lacking the "pipeline" context that `meltano elt` has, which configures the various tap/target env vars that the dbt invoker relies on. This makes sense to me- it wouldn't be possible for meltano to "know" how to invoke dbt correctly if there were multiple taps & targets configured in the project, each of which might have their own dbt project (?).

A reasonable solution to this would be something like: `meltano invoke dbt --with-schedule mysql-to-postgres` or something similar, which would load the same context that `meltano schedule run` uses...?


### Further regression test
_Ensure we automatically catch similar issues in the future_

- [ ] Write additional adequate test cases and submit test results
- [ ] Test results should be reviewed by a person from the team

_decoded_content.title: Support for DBT Snapshots
_decoded_content.description:
dbt supports [snapshots](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/building-a-dbt-project/snapshots) which is a way to store historical values for slowly changing data. You may need to run these before or after your model transformations.

`meltano elt` can run dbt model transforms, but snapshots have to be run manually with `meltano invoke dbt`.

I propose adding support for optionally triggering a snapshot as part of a transform operation.

It seems like `dbt snapshot` supports `--select` for only running certain models, although running it across the whole project wouldn't be a problem in my mind, since running it on a table that hasn't changed should be a no-op.

On #2300 the syntax `-t dbt:snapshot` was proposed by @DouweM

_decoded_content.title: Document how to use dbt integration with locally defined models in Data Transformation (T) doc
_decoded_content.description: See https://meltano.slack.com/archives/CFG3C3C66/p1597253244461700.

_decoded_content.title: Turn plugin `pip_url` into plugin extra so that transforms can use a different key for dbt package URLs
_decoded_content.description:
[Transforms](https://meltano.com/docs/plugins.html#transforms) are not pip packages, so them having a `pip_url` makes little sense. 

Instead, we should allow dbt transform plugins to point at dbt packages on DbtHub, a Git repo, or a local directory: https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/building-a-dbt-project/package-management/#git-packages.

This will also allow us to add a `docker_image` key as an alternative to `pip_url`: https://gitlab.com/meltano/meltano/-/issues/2205

We'll probably want to mark this extra setting as `protected: true`, so that its value cannot be overridden through the UI, which would potentially enable arbitrary code execution.
